title: Latency vs throughput
content:
Latency is the time to perform some action or to produce some result.

Throughput is the number of such actions or results per unit of time.

Generally, you should aim for maximal throughput with acceptable latency.

recommendations.title: Availability vs consistency
recommendations.content:
CAP theorem In a distributed computer system, you can only support two of the following guarantees: Consistency - Every read receives the most recent write or an error
Availability - Every request receives a response, without guarantee that it contains the most recent version o

recommendations.title: What is Composite pattern?
recommendations.content: In software engineering, the composite pattern is a partitioning design pattern. The composite pattern describes a group of objects that are treated the same way as a single instance of the same type of object. recommendations.title: Find total ways to reach the nth stair using step 1, 2 or 3.
recommendations.content:
A frog is jumping up a staircase with n steps and can hop either 1 step, 2 steps, or 3 steps at a time.
Implement a method to count how many possible ways the frog can run up the stairs.
